jparsec.graph

Class CreateVISADChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.CreateVISADChart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, visad.DisplayListener

    public class CreateVISADChart
extends java.lang.Object
implements visad.DisplayListener, java.io.Serializable
    A class to show cubes of data and surfaces using VisAD. A chart created with VisAD can be rotated with the mouse. Zoom is possible by dragging the chart with the mouse (like in the rotation) but with shift key pressed. A pan mode is possible doing the same with Ctrl key pressed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CreateVISADChart

        public CreateVISADChart(VISADCubeElement cube,
                double initVelocity,
                boolean showVPlane)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a standard VISAD datacube using right ascension, declination, and velocity.
        Parameters:
        initVelocity - Initial velocity to show.
        cube - The cube to show.
        showVPlane - True to show a second panel with the flux in a given velocity plain.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an exception occurs.

      • CreateVISADChart

                 throws JPARSECException

        Throws:

      • CreateVISADChart

        public CreateVISADChart(GridChartElement chart)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a 3d surface. The labels for x, y, and z axis (legend) should not contain any strange characters (spaces, point, comma, ...).
        Parameters:
        chart - The surface element object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
